title: LP gain amount should not correlate with damage done to champions for supports

replies.body: Well your wish is granted because it doesn't

that explains why i get 20 LP on {{champion:267}} if i build {{item:3071}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3123}} but have score of 5/11/12 
but I get 18 LP if i build legit support items and have score of 5/2/31

*edit: score of 5/11/12 with 25k damage to champions, score of 5/2/31 with 8k damage to champions

and also, getting 20 LP instead of 18 LP everytime i go {{champion:1}} or {{champion:99}}.

I would like an explanation for those phenomenon if damage done to champs doesnt matter

LP gains can fluctuate slightly unless you are on massive losing or winning streaks.  And why do you assume any kind of correlation between damage done and LP when the changes are 2 points but the damage done in one game is 3 times the amount of a different game? Don't you think that in 6 seasons of this game more support mains wouldn't notice significant differences in LP gains if damage done mattered?

LP gains have literally nothing to do with score in a game. How much you earn/lose depends on how often you win or lose and your MMR, that's why if you win a huge amount you start getting more LP per win and if you lose a lot more than you win you gain very little LP per win until you win rate gets closer to 50%
*edit: score of 5/11/12 with 25k damage to champions, score of 5/2/31 with 8k damage to champions
It depends on your MMR and the MMR of the people you're playing against.
